page.title: 02AGRICULTURE
page.content: Cuttleford Farm,Congleton Road,Moreton Cuttleford Farm is situated on the Cheshire plain on very fertile land.It is a mixed farm of 135 acres, consisting of 55 acres of barley, 12 acres of potatoes and 68 acres of grass.The owner has 32 Friesian cows producing 400 litres of milk per day. The calves are sent to a farm in Staffordshire to be fattened for beef. Hay making takes place three times a year and is one of the busiest times on the farm.Seasonal workers help with this job.The hay is stored as winter food for the cattle.The farmer has two tractors,a potato harvester,two trailers,a mower,a hay turner,a plough and a muckspreader to help him on the farm.This farm is typical of many in the area although alot of them cut grass to make silage instead of making hay.
